subCards.title: India's Updated Quake Map Warns Entire Himalayan Arc Faces Major Risk, Forcing Urgent Safety Reforms
subCards.abstract: India’s new seismic zonation map has rewritten the nation’s earthquake risk profile by elevating the entire Himalayan corridor into the highest danger Zone VI. Experts say the shift corrects decades of underestimation of the central Himalayan segment, where locked faults continue accumulating stress powerful enough to generate a massive surface-rupturing earthquake. Using global PSHA standards, the updated Earthquake Design Code integrates active faults, maximum magnitudes, soil behaviour, near-fault motion and exposure-based vulnerability. As a result, 61% of India’s land is now officially under moderate to high seismic hazard. The fresh norms introduce strict requirements for buildings, focusing for the first time on non-structural failures that often cause injuries. Critical infrastructure must stay operational even after severe shaking. This map is a blueprint for survival, forcing India to confront its most dangerous natural threat.

images.title: India's Updated Quake Map Warns Entire Himalayan Arc Faces Major Risk, Forcing Urgent Safety Reforms

cards.title: 'Survived Drowning, Escaped A Bomb Blast, Gave Up Non-Veg': PM Modi On VP Radhakrishnan's Early Life
cards.abstract: Newly elected Vice President C.P. Radhakrishnan took charge as Speaker and Chairperson of the Rajya Sabha as the Winter Session of Parliament began. Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed him, sharing personal anecdotes from Radhakrishnan’s early life. Modi highlighted his dedication to the marginalized, recalling a childhood near-drowning incident at Avinashi Temple and narrowly escaping a bomb blast in Coimbatore. He also mentioned Radhakrishnan’s visit to Kashi, where a spiritual experience led him to give up non-vegetarian food. PM Modi emphasized how these experiences shaped Radhakrishnan’s life and service, underlining his commitment to public welfare and personal values, while celebrating the Vice President’s journey and his role in strengthening the Upper House.

cards.title: Goldy Dhillon Gang Member Arrested In Delhi For Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe Shootings Across Canada
cards.abstract: The Delhi Police Crime Branch has cracked the chilling series of shootings targeting Kapil Sharma’s Kap’s Café in Surrey, Canada, by arresting the suspected main conspirator, Bandhu Maan Singh Shekhon. Linked to the Goldy Dhillon gang, Shekhon was seized with a Chinese PX-3 pistol, revealing how Indian gang networks have penetrated a foreign crime scene. Kap’s Café suffered three attacks since July, gunfire at 4:30 am, Molotov cocktails, CCTV-captured drive-by shootings, and intimidation videos released by suspects. Claims of responsibility came from Goldy Dhillon, Kulvir Sidhu and BKI terrorist Harjeet Singh Laddi, each threatening more action and accusing Bollywood figures of “anti-religious remarks.” The gang even said Kapil did not answer their calls. With threats now pointed at Mumbai, this video unravels the gang war, the arrest, the Canadian links and the growing Indo-foreign criminal nexus.

images.title: Goldy Dhillon Gang Member Arrested In Delhi For Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe Shootings Across Canada
